meanings.definition: A mistake or error in judgment.
meanings.sent1: She made several slipups on her math test.
meanings.sent2: Learning from slipups is important for personal growth.
meanings.sent3: His slipups in the kitchen turned the dinner into a comedy show.
meanings.sent4: The team's slipups cost them the championship title.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used the student's slipups as examples for the class to learn from.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I tend to slipups when I rush through my work.
meanings.sent2: It's okay to slipups as long as you learn from them.
meanings.sent3: She slipups often, but she always tries her best.
meanings.sent4: His tendency to slipups led to his demotion at work.
meanings.sent5: The athlete knew he couldn't afford any slipups during the final match.

meanings.definition: The act of slipping or sliding.
meanings.sent1: The icy road caused many slipups for the drivers.
meanings.sent2: The child's laughter filled the air as he enjoyed the slipups on the ice.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's slipups on the ice made the zoo visitors giggle.
meanings.sent4: The graceful figure skater had no slipups during her performance.
meanings.sent5: The slipups on the wet floor led to a caution sign being put up.
